posts.post_content:
[Kelinore Bat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kelinore Bat). Why the name change after only a year?  
  
Edit : @chinkeeyong, I'm just wondering why they didn't reprint [Feral Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Shadow), [Dusk Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dusk Imp), or [Moaning Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moaning Spirit). They had just printed a variation of the three with a new name, then did it again, less then a year later. I just feel like they are taking old cards, reprinting them with new names and calling them new cards. I feel sort of cheated. Imagine if they did this with [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt). Can you imagine having 20 [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)s in one deck? Because as of right now I can have 20 common 2/1 fliers for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) with no other abilities in a single deck.
posts.html:
Kelinore Bat. Why the name change after only a year?

Edit : @chinkeeyong, I'm just wondering why they didn't reprint Feral Shadow, Dusk Imp, or Moaning Spirit. They had just printed a variation of the three with a new name, then did it again, less then a year later. I just feel like they are taking old cards, reprinting them with new names and calling them new cards. I feel sort of cheated. Imagine if they did this with Lightning Bolt. Can you imagine having 20 Lightning Bolts in one deck? Because as of right now I can have 20 common 2/1 fliers for with no other abilities in a single deck.
